newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK PIRAEUSBANK EYES TIGHT-LIPPED SIGMA.
newsitem.headline: GREEK PIRAEUSBANK EYES TIGHT-LIPPED SIGMA.

text.p: Financial press reports that Piraeus Bank has agreed to acquire a major stake in Athens stock exchange member Sigma Securities were not confirmed by either side.
Sigma's managing director John Marcopoulos, contacted by Reuters in New York, would neither confirm or deny the press reports that have sparked talk in the market.
Asked whether it was a done deal, Marcopoulos said: "No comment for the time being."

Piraeus Bank president Michael Sallas told Reuters that talks were indeed at a progressed stage but nothing was finalised or signed yet. Discussion would resume after Marcopoulos' return from the U.S.
"The issue has not been finalised. Talks will continue when Mr. Marcopoulos returns," Sallas told Reuters.
Market watchers say Piraeus Bank's foray into the brokerage business, part of its expansion strategy, is a move that will benefit the bank.
Sigma, one of the leading brokers, has an established brand name, strong foreign clientele and a high market share of the bourse's business.

Based on recent brokers association (SMEHA) statistics it did 7.4 percent of the exchange's trading volume in the first quarter ranking second place among the bourse's 63 member brokers. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
